p: All the compounds, with the exception of sericic acid, sericoside and resveratrol-3- O- β-rutinoside, were isolated for the first time from the root bark of T. sericea. Sericic acid was identified as a marker for branch (X), while sericoside was identified as the marker for branch (Z) ( Figure 1A). Although the marker for branch (Y) was not isolated in this study, the molecular ion ( m/z 682) and retention time (4.66 min) is characteristic of a triterpenoid glycoside. The concentration of resveratrol-3- O- β-rutinoside was high in samples found in branches (X) and (Z), but low in samples in branch (Y).
